column1: fullish and swinging a touch as Finch presses forward and steers one wide of mid-off to get going straight away
length, 84mph and this comes back in a fraction to the left-hander, Head takes his bottom hand off but manages to squirt the ball away through square leg for a couple
short of a length outside off, Head is positive from the outset and throws his hands through a drive, not quite timed but they get three towards deep extra cover
good length, up at 89mph as Finch comes across to defend softly
pushes this one down the leg side
rising off a length, thudding into the bat label as Finch defends on off stump
pounds a length, tight lines and blocked once more
over the wicket, angling in and defended on off stump

full, lavish swing for Willey, that's nicked straight to slip on the drive! Head doesn't dally, he was looking to get on top but the ball moved a fair way from him, a loose shot having failed to size up the conditions, England have their breakthrough
good length, shaping in and out on off, Marsh blocks
good line, 83mph and straightening as Marsh dabs it down square on the off side
lovely timing, Willey keeps the ball pitched up but Marsh is well across and pings it hard and flat past cover for four
drops a touch short and Marsh is on to this, too, quick hands as he rifles another boundary through point. Boshed
length ball, defended around off stump
smashed back down the ground! Overpitched and Finch leans on a drive that whistles past mid-off
touch short, into the pads as Finch hangs back in the crease... high and leg side, though
in the channel, 86mph and threatening to come in, Finch blocks square
touch wider, 88mph and left alone this time
gets a touch too straight, pitched up and looking for lbw but Finch whips it away, using the pace... Willey does really well out by the deep midwicket rope to pull it in and prevent four
length ball, curling in as Finch chops down and gets a thick inside edge through backward square leg for a couple
fuller, shaping on the pads, worked wide of mid-on for one
testing line, 81mph and curving through past off stump as Marsh steps across and shoulders arms
touch short outside off, Marsh taps it down in front of gully for a single
lovely stroke from Finch, he has found his Pom-bashing groove already, gets a stride in and laces the drive through extra cover
good length, 82mph outside off, left alone
shortish and defended down into the leg side
full around middle and off, 89mph and Marsh drives, the bat turns in the hands as it rolls to mid-on
a touch leg side again, but Marsh can't get it away
full on off, 88mph and stroked back down the pitch without timing, mid-off comes across
pitched up, no width and again Marsh tucks the ball along the carpet to mid-off
draws his length back a fraction, 88mph and spandex tight, all Marsh can do is defend into the covers - and that's a maiden over from Wood
good lines, shaping in as Finch comes across and blocks on off
on the spot again, good length and all Finch can do is defend once again
slightly fuller and that's nicely played, not quite out of the middle and mid-off slides across to prevent a boundary
good length, 84mph and sliding into the lefty, Marsh blocks back down the track
over the top of off, not so much swing now, defended from the crease
again no width on offer, Marsh manages to shovel the ball to leg, past midwicket for a hasty single
shot! Marsh shows some Test-match class with a straight drive eased back down the ground, past mid-off and that'll be four
back of a length, 88mph on the pads and tapped down square
short again, Marsh turns off his hip with alacrity... and he's timed that nicely, past square leg and the man fine isn't able to get around and prevent four
back of a length, 87mph and nudged off the body in front of square for one
full and clipped firmly wide of mid-on, Willey does well diving across to stop it one-handed and hurl in a shy at the stumps
Marsh gets into line and defends
full and tempting on off stump, driven firmly but straight to mid-off
short and straight, Finch tickles the ball through backward square leg for one
turned into the leg side
pitched up and punched to mid-off, tight single but the throw is wayward
cross-seam bumper, Marsh is a bit late on the pull and sends it scuttling towards short fine leg... where Adil Rashid manages to wrong foot himself, and gifts a single
full length, driven to mid-off
round the wicket, tossed up on off stump, stroked to mid-off
full and drifting into the pads, Marsh drills it back past the diving Moeen, long-on is back offering protection
flat and going on towards off stump, defended from the crease

tossed up invitingly, Finch opens his body to go up and over... but only skews a thick outside edge to short third man! England have got rid of the dangerous Finch, Australia's most-experienced batsman, trying to get on top of Moeen but miscuing against the spin
pushed through on the stumps, Stoinis blocks
flat and quick, darted outside off and the ball comes off a thick outside edge, they scamper through as the throw comes in
hits a length in the channel, poked into a gap
full, gets him coming forwards, driven uppishly but it bobbles between two men in the covers
back of a length, chopped down into the off side
full, sliding in, 80mph and Marsh works a couple off his pads - Australia bring up their first 50 in the tenth over
full length outside off, 83mph and picks out mid-off coming forwards
drifting on to the pads but Marsh's leg glance runs quickly to Rashid at short fine leg and there's no run
tossed up from over the wicket and worked with the spin through square leg
bowled 'im! Moeen straightens one and Marsh plays the wrong line, he's off on the Bakerloo as the ball chugs down the Piccadilly to topple off stump. England on top, here

slightly short and Paine is busy in the crease, rocks back and slams a cut through the covers... Willey gives chase and looks to have prevented four, but the umpires decide that he moved the boundary markers back as he slid through and the ball would have reached the rope, so a boundary is signalled
flat on off, better length and that's defended
tossed up and flicked slightly aerially to the leg side
Paine gets into line and defends
pushes through a flat legbreak outside off, left alone by Stoinis
pushed through on the stumps, blocked
touch short, Stoinis stays back and punches a single to long-off
tossed up on off, Paine taps one through the covers
nicely slighted legbreak, gripping a touch as the batsman defends watchfully on off
slider, out the front of the hand, Stoinis is equal to it and punches back towards the bowler
Paine uses the feet, comes down and clips the ball back to the bowler
now he drops in the crease and dabs a single wide of short third man
flighted, played with the spin to the on side
angled in with the arm, Stoinis punches back to the bowler
clips a single down the ground to long-on
floated up, Paine happy to knock it around and get the scoreboard ticking, one more through mid-on
punched into the off side and Roy misfields at cover to give them a single
flighted, on the stumps and knocked back down the track
pushed through, googly or maybe another slider, worked off the pads
now that is the wrong'un, Paine plays an expansive drive and is beaten, the ball sliding inches past off stump as Buttler then whips off the bails
stays in the crease and works to the on side
comes forward and punches one to long-off
pushed through on the stumps, dabbed into the covers
comes across and works a single down the ground
shout of 'catch!' as Stoinis chips the ball with the spin, lands safely on the leg side
flat on the stumps, Stoinis prods it away
flighted, Stoinis tries to clip a drive down the ground but skews the ball towards mid-off
tossed up and punched to a fielder again... not looking the most convincing against spin, is Stoinis
Rashid tosses the ball up and Paine drives for a single
gives it some air, the legbreak on off stump, punched to long-off
full, slow and floaty, Paine drives inside to out but picks out extra cover
baited, tossed up wide of the stumps, Paine watches it spin away into the gloves
comes forward and dabs a single wide of extra cover
flighted, outside the line of off, gets a stride in and belts a flat drive wide of long-off for a couple

oh dear, what was that from Paine?! Makes a pre-meditated move outside off, brings out the reverse-sweep... and lobs a gentle top edge to short third man! He completely telegraphed his intentions, Buttler was almost far enough across to intercept the ball himself, but to compound that the execution was poor, hitting against the offspin, and he's gifted Moeen a third!
full outside off, whipped into midwicket
gets across to off stump and worked with a closed face into the leg side
gets away with a leading edge this time as he again looks to flick to the leg side, falls short of cover
now he brings out a big sweep, doesn't make contact, gets taken on the pad, well outside the line
pushed into midwicket with a straight bat
good length outside off, a leg-break, left alone
full at off stump, pushed into the covers with an open face
short of a length, onto the back foot, driven wide of short cover to long-off
a fraction short outside off, plays back and drives to deep cover
full and straight, pushed down the ground to long-on
plays back again and punches to long-off
gets well across onto off stump and sweeps behind square
back of a length outside off, pushed to the man at short mid-on
back and across, short of a length, pushed to cover
that breaks the shackles! Uses his feet then lofts high over long-on. A clean swing of the bat
touch quicker and flatter, outside off, slides off a thickish outside edge into backward point
works a straight ball off the pads through square and that's good running to make the second
full outside off, bowled quite slowly, Stoinis pushes square to point
full and straight, driven to long-off
a straighter, quicker, delivery angled into the pads and pushed down to long-on
edged and gone! Caught behind...not the best ball Rashid has bowled, it's short outside off, Stoinis shapes to cut but can only managed a thin top edge to Buttler
works a full ball back to the bowler
very full, a yorker, dug out back down the pitch
good length at off stump, gets forward and works into midwicket
back to a slightly shorter ball, pushed to short mid-on
driven off the back foot to cover
forward outside off and defends a full delivery
short of a length, back into leg stump and drives to cover. Can't find the gap
works a straight ball into midwicket and that's a maiden for Moeen
tucks a straight ball off his pads behind square
leans back and cuts this from around off stump to deep cover
full outside off, gets forward and drives wide of short cover
a flat-batted drive finds cover as he tries to give himself a touch of room
that's a big ugly, aims a big swing into the leg side and gets a thick inside edge that runs through square leg...was a googly
full and straight, driven to mid-off
full outside off, defended into midwicket
takes this off the stumps, leans back and drives to long-off
round the wicket, full and straight, driven back to Moeen
goes back to a reasonably full delivery and punches down the ground
drives off the back foot to cover
sweeps a straight delivery to backward square leg, who is quite fine, so just a single...you can sense Maxwell getting twitchy
tucks a straight ball into square leg and scampers back for the second...that was reasonably tight
driven off the back foot through the off side, wide of the sweeper, to bring up Australia's hundred
pushed to long-on
round the wicket, angled in at middle and leg, full, pushed to midwicket
gets forward and defends with bat and pad together
full, at middle and leg, pushed to the on side and Root gets across in his follow through
works a straight delivery to midwicket
touch fuller, closes the face and works it behind square on the leg side
full and straight, driven to mid-off
slides on with the air from round the wicket, driven to cover
full at off stump and driven to cover
full, outside off, gets forward and drives to deep cover...that's the halfway mark of the innings
round the wicket, defended
full and straight, driven down to long-off
flicked off the pads behind square on the leg side...Maxwell now batting in a cap
pushed into the pads from round the wicket but it's worked straight to midwicket
driven down the ground to long-off
taken from around off stump through square leg
touch short outside off, doesn't get any timing, off the toe of the bat to cover
gets this one away...fuller outside off, a cracking, skimming, drive which flies wide of mid-off inside the circle
back to back boundaries, this one is dragged down short, Maxwell rocks back and pull powerfully through midwicket
full outside off, driven to cover
that's a magnificent shot! Maxwell is finding his touch. Gives himself a fraction of room, drives inside-out over wide long-off
works into midwicket
full and straight, driven to long-off
launched over long-off again! Maxwell fighting back. Stays in his crease and drives through the line of a length delivery. Miles into the stands
flicked into midwicket
nicely driven wide of cover to long-off
fires this down the leg side, think he thought Maxwell was coming down the pitch
starts to shuffle to leg then gets back in line and works to midwicket
full, forced through midwicket with a straight bat
full at off stump, driven firmly into the pitch and back at Plunkett who parries it to mid-off
good length, played off the front foot
back of a length at off stump, driven to Plunkett again
touch wider outside off, good length, Maxwell's bat twists his hand as he plays forward and again Plunkett picks up
full and straight, driven to mid-off...five dot balls to start
what a lovely piece of timing! The over is spoiled for Plunkett, a good-length delivery just slipping into the pads, clipped through midwicket
over the wicket, full at middle, flicked to mid-on
on the pads, tucked wide of midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched to deep cover
a bouncer, over leg stump at 83mph
another short one, straighter and a touch quicker, Agar sways out of the line
back of a length at middle and off, defended to backward point
short of a length outside off, drags his pull to mid-on
short of a length outside off, gets on his toes and pushes into the covers to bring up the fifty stand
good length at off stump, driven to deep cover
full and straight, driven firmly towards mid-on, Hales, on the edge of the circle...Hales throw is miles wide of the stumps but Maxwell was fine
good length, straight, pushed to the bowler
touch short outside off, cut hard into the square and it bounces over backward point
full and straight, hint of shape in at the stumps, driven to mid-off
good length at off stump, shovelled towards mid-on with a bit of bottom hand
beats the outside edge with a back-of-a-length delivery, 87mph, angled across Agar who drives
goes wide on the crease and sends down a bouncer on the line of leg stump, Agar gets inside the line
comes round the wicket, back of a length at off stump, played to the on side and Wood skips across
touch fuller, at off stump, driven mid-off. Well bowled by Wood
short of a length, worked into midwicket and that's his fifty off 52 balls. Much needed for him and the team
terrific shot, round the wicket, angled in at the stumps and delightfully whipped wide of mid-on for his first boundary
short of a length outside off, played to backward point
plays this very well, brilliantly in fact, he was cramped for room a touch but managed to angled it wide of backward point and also beat third man
back of the wicket, full outside off, chopped to backward point
length ball at the pads, pushed firmly to midwicket where Moeen prevents the single
big appeal for lbw but Rob Bailey says not out, a length ball that nipped back, was high and heading leg side
short of a length, pulled to deep square leg
full at off stump, driven into the pitch and it bounces to Morgan at cover for a crowd catch
back of a length at off stump, rolls his fingers across it, defended
short ball, doesn't get it out of the middle as he pulls, loops over midwicket
tucked off the pads behind square
short outside leg stump, called wide
good length at off stump, pushed to mid-off
tight at middle and off, defended into the leg side
plays a punchy drive to mid-off
good length outside off, he leans forward and drives to deep point
a short delivery and more excellent placement from Maxwell as he swivels on a pull and places it wide of deep square
goes full and straight, clipped off his toes to long leg, takes on Rashid who doesn't produce the best of the throws. Would have been tight with a good return
over the wicket, 77mph around off stump, Agar nudges one down the ground
on the hips, Maxwell misses with a flick and it rolls towards short fine leg
length ball, 82mph and clipped for one to deep midwicket hanging back
full in the channel, drilled through the covers for one
punched off a length back to the bowler, Willey then hurls the ball at the stumps/the batsman, Maxwell hopping to get out of the way
chopped into the covers, Roy can only get a fingertip on it
short outside off and whipped away with a wristy pull to deep backward square leg
back of a length over the stumps, Agar stays deep and swipes one through cover
83mph and punched in front of deep cover, they come a back for a couple
cutting his fingers over the ball, mistimed back to the bowler

flicked off his legs, but in the air... and Bairstow snags it on the run at deep square leg! Plunkett gets Maxwell, bit of luck involved as he pretty much struck that too well - an aggressive pick up but it went high, and sailed into the sweeper's path running back from midwicket! A tidy knock from Maxwell but he can't go on, England break the recovery stand
tucked away for a single
over the wicket, flat legbreak outside off, Agar swipes it to mid-off
tossed up and prodded back down the pitch
flighted, Agar tucks a single down the ground to long-on
pushes the slider out the front of the hand, Neser dabs his first ball away in front of point and they scurry through to get him off the mark
lobbed up nice and slow, pushed through mid-off coming forwards
gives this some air, the legbreak spinning away on middle, hits the splice as Neser defends
slightly full and wide, Agar is well across and he rifles a drive past extra cover for a welcome boundary
short of a length, forced off the back foot to mid-off
angled in straighter and worked to the leg side
touch short, 81mph and punched firmly off the back foot to deep point
too full again, Agar latches on and belts another drive past extra cover
pitched up and deflected towards midwicket
floated up and Neser blaps a drive towards mid-off
slips in the googler, comes back at him, chopped down late
gets forward, punched to extra cover on the bounce
flighted, tries to comes down but only steers it to extra cover

tosses up the legbreak on middle and leg, Neser gets out and opens up to push through cover point, there's a moment's hesitation as they come back for two, Bairstow is running in off the rope... but his throw is poor and Neser gets in safely
floated up on off stump, driven to wide long-off
full, clipped off the toes to midwicket
pitched up on middle and leg, again Neser picks out a fielder with a drive to mid-on
shuffles into line and works this wide of mid-on for a single
good length, 84mph and hitting high up the bat as he pushes forward
comes across on off stump and mistimes a push into the covers
full and straighter, pinged back through mid-on for a single... but just two off the over

very full, Agar goes to sweep - misses and is plumb! Rob Bailey sends him on his way, no review from Agar, that struck him low down on the back pad as the ball straightened... only one place that delivery was ending up. Decent knock in adversity from Agar, but Australia are now seven down and in danger of not seeing out the overs
legbreak on off, Tye covers the line as it straightens
full and straight, the slider from Rashid... and Tye belts it unceremoniously back over the bowler's head for a no-nonsense four
gets across and defends
another shout for lbw, pitched on leg stump... but looks like that was a googly, would have been sliding down
tossed up and defended into the covers
length ball, Neser pats it away

goes for the slog down the ground, the ball not full enough for the shot... and mid-off settles under it for a simple catch! Neser tries to hit out and instead gets out, a second wicket for Plunkett and this innings is ending rather like it started
shot! High elbow, out of the meat, Tye showcases his straight drive again, slightly overpitched and he whacks it for another four
back of a length, 81mph and defended down into the covers from in front of the stumps
dug in short, Tye hangs back and flinches out of the way
short of a length, 79mph and possibly a cutter, short-armed towards mid-on
tosses up the legbreak, Richardson defends his first ball
pushes forward and works a single away past midwicket
flighted, Tye swings across the line and gets a big top edge, clears slip and runs away for a couple
tossed up outside off, Tye flat-bats it down the ground to long-off
flat on the stumps, Richardson drops back and defends with a straight bat
pushes the googly down the leg side
flighted, this rips away as Richardson has a big old swing and a miss, Buttler breaks the bails but he had the back foot safely anchored
short outside off, Tye runs it away to third man
pitched up, 84mph and Richardson plinks one into the covers
prodded square from the crease
bangs in the short ball, Richardson isn't looking to play those
another bumper, this time he thinks about pulling, then thinks again
on the stumps, 83mph and blocked... just a single off the over
short ball, Tye rocks back and slugs it to midwicket
goes fuller, 87mph and driven for a single to long-on
pitched up, slapped to mid-off! Wood has a wicket, Richardson losing patience and picking out the man on the edge of the ring
round the wicket, fires in a yorker on off stump, Stanlake does well to keep it out
hits a length, 85mph and Stanlake prods to backward point
fizzes down another attempted yorker, up by the bootstraps but he's alert to the danger once more
tasty bouncer from Plunkett, crowding Tye as he tries to pull, is tucked up and beaten
back of a length, 84mph and past the outside edge as he tries to dab one from the crease

short of a length, cross seam and skidding on as Tye windmills across the line... and gets a top edge into his face! He seems okay, waggling his head back at the bowler, the grille did its job; but he'll need to be checked over by the physio, just in case
another short ball, goes for it again - SPANKED! Tye gets hold of an old-fashioned mow across the line and pounds six over deep midwicket! Back atcha
fuller, angling in and the ball deflects off a leading edge

takes the pace off, Tye dabs at it off the back foot... but only succeeds in tickling a low edge through to Buttler! He took that well, diving forwards, Tye shakes his head but his fun is over - time to think about bowling, with just 214 to defend
back of a length, 85mph and pushed into the covers off the back foot

straight through him! Stanlake shivers Roy's timbers with his second ball, a ferocious nip-backer, 90mph and maybe flicked the inside edge before smacking off stump right in the eye! That's a corking nut first up, Australia have the early lift with the ball they needed
short outside off, climbing through as Hales shoulders arms
fired in straighter, 89mph and tucked down calmly to the leg side
full around off, 91.3mph this time, real licks on the ball from Lil Bill - defended
quick, above 90mph again, Hales rasps a back-foot punch straight to point
length around off, 82mph, Bairstow works it away through backward square leg for a couple
pitched up and driven, sounded sweet off the bat but straight to mid-on
smashed through point... Minimal foot movement but there's no swing and he just cracks square it for four
angled in with the arm and clipped towards mid-on
bit of nibble, 83mph but it takes the outside edge, flies wide of slip for four! Went quickly and low, no chance of a catch unless there was another man in
good length on off, Bairstow comes across
back of a length, tapped into the off side
short ball, sits up outside off, Hales swings breezily and plonks the ball up and away away over midwicket for four more, first runs off Stanlake
full outside off, 91mph and driven in front of square, Agar gets a hand on it in the covers to prevent four
crunched through cover point, bit of width and YJB climbs into it, races away
overpitched, Bairstow times the pants os this drive, zips through the covers for another boundary!
fullish, on the stumps and clipped to mid-on
good length, holding its line outside off, Hales prods into the covers
touch short, 83mph and steered towards point from the crease

full and straight, hit on the back pad... given! Dharmesena's finger goes up, Neser has his maiden international wicket! No review from Hales, sounded like there might have been an inside edge, but it was otherwise pretty adjacent, stuck on the crease and playing across the line
superb line and length, perfect to a new batsman, holding just enough to beat the outside edge as Root hangs back
pitched up, 83mph and blocked coming across
gets across and shows it a straight bat on off stump
shortish outside off, chopped into the covers
length, 88mph and met on the front foot, blocked to cover
back of a length, seaming a fraction as Bairstow forces away from his body, gets a thick inside edge past his legs for one
short and rising over the stumps, 89mph and Root jumps into line
plays this on the back foot, tapped to extra cover
pitched up, 87mph and driven, Stanlake fields in his follow through
and he's slapped away through backward point first ball, a 79mph loosener and YJB latches on
short and wide, again he chases a cross-batted shot but fails to connect
length ball, punched back to the on side
better lines, 83mph and nipping in as Bairstow taps into the covers from the crease
fullish in the channel, takes aim at another scything blow through the covers, mistimed
regal stuff from YJB, up on his toes and he clatters a back-foot drive in front of cover for another boundary... He's scored 27 out of England's 32 so far
length, tight lines and Root defends
pitched up, 80mph on the stumps, whipped away through midwicket, he has cover out there
full, tailing in towards middle and leg, dug out to mid-on
fourth-stump line, driven on the up to the man on the edge of the ring
on the stumps, worked across the line for a single
slightly overpitched, there's not much margin of error against a player of Root's class, he just leans on this and stroke his first boundary back down the ground
fired in on off, 82mph and Bairstow defends with the outside half of the bat

short ball, Bairstow rocks on to the pull - and swipes it straight down the throat of deep square leg! Daft shot choice, and Australia have a third! They are amongst 'em, Richardson strikes now, and it doesn't say how the batsman got out in t'book
over the wicket, length ball around off, Morgan shows it a straight bat
fullish, 83mph, defended back down the track
dug in, another half-tracker at 79mph and Morgan is more in control of his shot, pulled away in the air but wide of fine leg and he picks up a boundary to get off the mark
pitched up on off stump, blocked into the covers
fullish around off stump, Root chops down on it
comes across and pats the ball softly into the covers
full, clipped off the front pad but he finds midwicket
drops back outside off and runs the ball towards backward point, Morgan correctly says there's no run there
strays on to the pads, Root flicks it away firmly but Stanlake gets down well at short fine leg and prevents a boundary
back of a length in the channel, tapped towards extra cover
short of a length, 87mph and rearing at Root who rides it and guides one to third man
good length but blocked coming forward on off stump
angled across from over the wicket, 88mph and Morgan defends down into the turf outside off
bumper, touch leg side, climbs very high and Morgan watches it through
fuller, on the stumps, Morgan clips it without timing to mid-on
it's a bluff, Stanlake hits a length but there's width on offer, Morgan just uses the face and glides it for four through backward point
oh lovely. That's Root at this best, leaning into the drive and easing through the gap. Effortless and effective
up on the toes, tapped with a full blade into the covers for the single
through to the keeper, angling across the left-hander, tight to off stump and good carry
outside off, a slightly wider line, no stroke offered
hauled round the corner for a single
punched with lots of bottom hand into the covers
outside off, angling in, through to the keeper
outside off, tapped down to third man
on the toes, a touch misdirected and well chiselled through midwicket. England keep striding onwards, albeit with a few wobbles
hoping back and across, another single into the covers
well bowled, dipping late into the toes
attempted flick to the leg side, and golly, that rolled rather close to leg stump!
defended back down the pitch
on the back foot, punched into the off side
good confident stride across the crease to reach the wider delivery, and wristily drilled into the covers
hurried on the back foot, and had Maxwell gathered at cover that would have been close! He's furious with himself, Root was a goner with a direct hit!
blocked again on the back foot
slower ball, tapped to square leg for another single
low full toss, and out comes Morgan's paddywhack, reversing the hands to flog the ball straight to backward square. Connected well to no avail
forward and defended
pushed urgently back down the pitch
clipped uppishly to the leg side
eased to the on side, no way through there. Good lines from Agar
another reverse from Morgan and this time he beats the field! Top tonking from England's skipper
standing tall on the back foot and punched out to deep point
slashed hard through point and is that a drop? On the half-volley I reckon, Maxwell gets down low and does well to intercept, really
banged in short, ducked by Root, and Tye gets away with the wide. Well directed
eased into the covers, Root sets himself for two early and sprints urgently back
slower ball, wider line, pushed to point
slower ball, down the leg side, Root is miffed to miss out on a languid pull... looked like a flick of fabric there, but the umpire singles the wide
opens the face to glide a drive down to third man
driven into the covers
forward and finds the gap at cover
full face of the bat, pushing back down the line of the ball
back of a length, skidding through, defended back to the bowler who half-stops
back of a length once more, outside off, Morgan chops down into the crease, cramped for room on the late cut, and accepts the single behind the keeper
poked out to point. England content to deal in singles for the moment
up on the toes, another punched drive into space in the covers
poor ball, on the pads, back of a length, and that's a freebie as Morgan flicks his bat down the leg side and helps it on its way
looping slower ball, eased down the ground to mid-off
full length, driven to cover and it's a direct hit from Marsh! Morgan looked as though he was home, and sure enough, he's in by two feet
open faced dab through third man
short and hauled gleefully through square leg. England are starting to find their groove now. Singles aplenty, and the boundaries are a bonus
fully forward and blocked to cover
sliding back onto the stumps, and blocked in front of middle
open-faced steer, out to deep cover
gliding cut, out through point
solidly onto the front foot, and dabbed out to cover
cheeky from Root! Dropping to one knee in a premeditated move, and flicking the ball high over the keeper's head. That gets things moving again
outside off, wide line, left alone
striding forward and blocked down the pitch
width and cut to point
back of a length, and clipped to the leg side
punched into the covers off the back foot
flipped off the toes into the leg side once more
outside off, that's a lovely line, just back of a length. Beats the edge
angling into the pads, and helped round the corner
down the track, tucked up a touch, and nudged back down the pitch
banged in short, Morgan ducks
width, and cracked hard into the covers, gathered by the sweeper but that's good intent from Morgan

clipped in the air, out to deep midwicket, and there's some rather average fielding on the rope from Head, who slides round, deflects the ball five yards further along the rope, and just about claws it back in at the second attempt
on the back foot and pushed back down the pitch
another single into the gap
angling into the left hander and defended rather uneasily down into the crease
swept with a flourish out through backward square
head over the ball, straight back down the pitch
forward and blocked
length ball outside off, chopped down to third man
back of a length at middle and off, 86mph, defended
he's keen to get forward, pushes a back-of-a-length delivery on the walk into the covers
stays in his crease this time, short of a length, driven at the top of the bounce to mid-off
fuller, outside off, driven strongly square of the wicket to deep point
short of a length outside off, gets on top of bounce and plays into backward point
huge appeal for caught behind as Morgan hooks at a bouncer outside leg stump. But Paine declines to review. Not given wide. Passes close to bat and glove but no spike no Snicko
back of a length at middle and leg, defended
a slower ball, comes out as a full toss outside off, Morgan's slightly and drives in the air but finds a gap through the covers
length ball, straight, defended
good length at off stump, 84mph, defended back to the bowler
another short one, around leg stump, doesn't get as big on Morgan this time and he's able to hook to long leg
round the wicket, dragged down short outside off, Morgan rocks back and square cuts in front of point to reach his fifty off 58 balls
full at off stump, stretches forward and drives into the covers
touch short outside off, back cut into the point area
good delivery, straightens on Root and there's a touch of extra bounce, but pushed into the covers for a sharp single
driven off the back foot to cover
again a bit too short, Morgan whips it through straight midwicket off the back foot
dispatched through the off side! Short outside off, square drives through the covers, wide of the sweeper
back on off stump, short of a length, defended
short outside leg stump, bit of a freebie, Morgan swivels on a hook and gets it fine, wide of the keeper
short of a length on the hip, worked down to long leg and it's a tight second run but the dive gets him home
too straight, on the legs, worked to deep square leg
good length at off stump, defended
full and straight, flicked to deep midwicket
short, Root goes deep in his crease and pulls it backward of square, the sweeper is just able to cut it off and that's the hundred stand
tossed up full at the stumps, driven to long-off
punched back to the bowler
the bottom hand comes into play as he plays this down to long-on
skips back in the crease to a shortish delivery and pushes down the ground
back of a length outside off, a type dab with an open face that beats backward point
back of a length at off stump, 80mph, defended to the on side
touch shorter, forced into midwicket
almost finds midwicket this time, goes for a pull, the ball doesn't come on and takes the splice but falls just short
flicked off his body to deep square leg
back of a length outside, cut through point to the sweeper
short of a length at off stump, defended
terrific shot, latches on to a short ball outside off, cuts it up and over backward point and wide of third man. Top placement
touch fuller, played off the back foot to the covers
straighter delivery, at the stumps, just back of a length so defended from quite deep in the crease
fuller, at off stump, driven back past the bowler and mid-off is able to get across
short of a length, angled into the hip, tucked behind square
back of a length, straight, defended to mid-on
gets forward and drives into the covers
full at middle and off, a punchy drive finds mid-off
a very short delivery outside off, Paine does well to grab it one handed with a leap and no surprise that's a wide
good length, straight, worked into midwicket

he's got him, under edge to the keeper! Tye has provided the breakthrough. Comes round the wicket, it's not a great ball, short of a length outside off, and a thin bottom edge to Paine. That is actually the first ball round the wicket to Morgan from a quick bowler
back of a length at off stump, defended to midwicket
short outside off, back cut down to third man and that's his fifty from 65 balls
back of a length outside off, 89mph, left alone
what a shot! Buttler off the mark in style, just drives through the line of a full delivery and lofts it over mid-off. Bat actually twisted as he played that
gets right across outside off and defends a back-of-a-length delivery to cover

dropped, it would have been a good catch! A short ball, Buttler goes for the pull, gets a top edge and Paine does all the hard work to run back towards short fine leg, gets it in his gloves and then it bursts out as he falls to the ground
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
good length outside off, defended
saved by an inside edge as a full delivery shapes in towards the pads, takes a good whack of the bat on the way to the back pad
back of a length outside off, dabbed into the off side
that's a lovely short, wasn't a bad delivery, takes a stride forward and drives through the covers
fuller, he drives again, doesn't quite the timing this time and he finds mid-off
he's gone this time! The Tye slower ball has done the trick. It's the knuckle ball, full length, Buttler is through his shot far too early and offers a simple catch to mid-on
short of a length outside off, pushed to the covers
at off stump, defended to the off side
fantastic delivery, repeats the yorker, 89mph, dug out to the off side
banged in short, at Root, he's on his toes and defends from in front of his face
he's got him This is game on now! A good length ball outside off, Root playing with an open face outside off, and it's a thin edge
short of a length at the hip, worked into square leg
short of a length outside off, played from the back foot to cover
full at middle and off, defended
a good length ball, whipped to short midwicket
full at the stumps, flicked with plenty of bottom hand through midwicket
the slower ball also does it again, full outside off, Willey nearly through his drive but just manages to keep the ball down
a bouncer outside off, left alone
back of a length, pushed into the covers
back of a length at middle and off, defended
fuller, straighter, worked to the leg side
back of a length, looking to force this away and takes a thickish edge to the leg side
short outside leg stump, he rolls his wrists and pulls to long leg to get off the mark
good length at off stump, defended
short ball, Moeen connects nicely with his pull but there's good work by Neser at deep square
full at off stump, 75mph, defended to mid-on
back of a length at middle and off, nudged to the leg side. Tye certainly getting the ball to hold in the surface
short of a length outside off and that's an excellent shot, stands tall and square drives through point
leading edge almost finds cover as he looks to work a short-of-a-length delivery to the leg side
good length at off stump, played into point
full outside off, driven firmly to mid-off
defends a good length ball to cover
gets away with a top edge, a bouncer, Moeen goes for the hook and it flies almost straight over Paine
short of a length, defended
a slightly uppish drive, but safely through the covers and wide of the sweeper
short and he's quickly onto it, pulls through midwicket and the deep square sweep can't get close
good length at off stump, 83mph, defended
another boundary, a strong square drive from Willey as Neser offers up a touch of width outside, although was played on the up
straighter, worked to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, defended
a strangled appeal for lbw as Willey tries to work this off his pads, pitched outside leg
good delivery, hint of late movement away from Willey, takes a thick edge, but controlled, and runs to third man
short outside off, goes for the pull and gets a bottom edge to the leg side
full outside off, 72mph, dabbed down to third man
round the wicket, full at stump, flicked firmly to midwicket
full at off stump, defended
a slower ball, back of a length (out of the back of the hand), Willey picks it early and heaves it over wide mid-on
good length at off stump, 85mph, a conventional delivery, defended to cover
back of a length at middle and off, defended to mid-on
drives through the line of a full delivery, comes from quite low on the bat, but it's straight of mid-off
back of a length, pushed to the off side, he thinks of a single but is sent back by Willey
he's done it again! Moeen gives it away. A short delivery, angled across the body, he goes for the pull and gets a top edge which is taken at deep midwicket. Was aiming for the long boundary
back of a length outside off, defended to backward point
pumped down the ground! Not sure he was aiming that straight, a short of a length delivery which he carves off the back foot over mid-off
very full at off stump, driven into the pitch and it bounces to backward point
and there's one of them, 74mph, full outside off and beats the outside edge as Plunkett pushes forward

that's a beauty! Seam up this time, 84mph, beats the outside edge and skims past off stump. There was a noise on that! Did he edge it?! There was no appeal. Looks like the noise was bat clipping pad perhaps
full and straight, pushed to mid-off
full at off stump, 73mph, gets forward and pushes to cover. Subtle variations
full and straight, 85mph, he lunges forward and it runs into the leg side
good length outside off, defended to cover
gets squared up as he defends this good length delivery
good length at middle and off, defended back down the pitch
full outside off, driven towards mid-off who is just hanging back a little
good length at off stump, blocked through the off side, point can't get across and it runs to the cover sweeper
he's like that area today! Touch of width outside off, driven on the up behind point and it beats third man...Tye could have done better with his attempt to flick it back
full at off stump, driven to deep cover
defeated by a slower one again, dropped in short, he's through his pull way to early, goes on the second bounce to Paine
good length, angled in from round the wicket, defended to the off side ring
nips in on a good length, Willey is slightly hurried into his defensive shot
short outside off, 73mph, defended to backward point
full at off stump, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, straight, takes a bit of a leading edge back down the pitch
full at off stump, driven to cover
full and straight, slower ball at 73mph, worked down the on side
length ball, straight, defended
full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
full and straight, he can't beat Richardson in his follow through. A maiden. That's not an issue for England
short of a length, worked into midwicket
tucked off the pads through square leg
full at off stump, he plays forward and it slides off the outside edge to third man
short of a length, almost pushes through the line a little early
drives a length ball on the up to mid-off, there's a direct hit but Willey is safe and the ball rebounds away for an extra run
good way to finish things! Full and straight, drills through the line it flies into the stands
